text.__SUMMARY__: The black-capped siskin (Spinus atriceps) is a species of finch in the Fringillidae family. It is found in Guatemala and Mexico. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist montane forests and heavily degraded former forest.
text.Phylogeny: It has been obtained by Antonio Arnaiz-Villena et al.
text.Identification:
Spinus atriceps has been defined as a gray wash with a black cap finch. However, other green morphs have been also identified with Spinus atriceps, but they apparently are Spinus/Carduelis pinus green morphs.
